instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
No history on this. Board was clean. <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has no wifi for no known/visible reasons. 1.8V and 3v3 are present so I believed it was the wifi chip itself. I tried reballing it but no change. I tried pulling same part number wifi chip from other board with associated ROM chips and no change. I then ordered a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> donor board to see if it was related to prior attempt being from a different model. Pulled Wifi and WLAN and BT roms from 01598 donor and no change. I tried restoring from DFU to see if maybe T2 needed reflash and no change.

Broken trace wouldn't make sense to me. I'm thinking there's a weak link. Suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3701</CHIP> controls both wifi and bluetooth.
Bluetooth works correctly?
No wifi hardware detected at all on System Information?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
No bluetooth or Wifi hardware detected in system info. It shows software versions only for wifi.

So, I had tried pulling <CHIP>U3701</CHIP>, <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>, <CHIP>U3750</CHIP> from another 01598 board and I believe it went pretty well as far as reballing the donor <CHIP>U3701</CHIP> and placing. I thought that would've resolved any issues or at least after T2 restore but nada.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
Apart of power rails (1V8/<SIGNAL>3V3_G3S_WLANBT</SIGNAL>), check all resistors from page 32.
Few caps to check on the PCIE data lines too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: Going to be a no fix. All I can guess is maybe T2 issue. Connectivity on <CHIP>U3701</CHIP> seemed pretty good and couldn't find any issues with the caps or resistors around it. Inspected the board again and just not seeing anything out of place.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
